item.title: "The big ripoff": the J6 committee's revelation about a fake Trump election defense fund, explained
item.description:
It was a scam built on the big lie. The January 6 committee dropped a bombshell right at the end of Monday’s hearing: The Trump campaign raised huge sums for a “defense” fund during the period between Election Day 2020 and the January 6 insurrection. That fund didn’t actually exist…

item.title: Why is American administrative capacity in decline?
item.description:
Ezra Klein recently wrote a provocative and thoughtful piece about administrative capacity in the modern American state. The key claim is summarized here: I’ve spent most of my adult life trawling think tank reports to better understand how to solve problems. When I go looking for ideas on how to build state capacity on the left, I don’t find much. The…

URL: https://donmoynihan.substack.com/p/why-is-american-administrative-capacity?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: The Federal Reserve Will Move on Thursday. What Will/Should It Do?, &

item.title: Age of Invention: Why wasn't the Steam Engine Invented Earlier? Part I
item.description:
You’re reading Age of Invention, my newsletter on the causes of the British Industrial Revolution and the history of innovation. This edition went out to over 8,300 subscribers. If you’ve just been forwarded this, you can sign up here: As regular readers might have noticed, it’s been a long time since my last newsletter — far, far longer than usual. Although I haven’t been posting, however, I have been hard at work researching. I had to translate a lot of primary sources from sixteenth-century French, Italian, Dutch, German, and even Latin, so that was already going to cause a delay. But then, the more I delved into the topic, the more I had to delay writing it up. Things I thought I knew, and on which I agreed with a lot of other historians, turned out to be ever more questionable. Perhaps even wrong. And so I had to delve ever deeper to get to the truth, and to reformulate what I knew…

URL: https://antonhowes.substack.com/p/age-of-invention-why-wasnt-the-steam?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: The Federal Reserve Will Move on Thursday. What Will/Should It Do?, &

item.title: Haiti, Slavery and John Stuart Mill
item.description:
My next book will be a biography of John Stuart Mill. So far, I’m enjoying it very much. Mill was an unusual man who lived an extraordinary life devoted to a set of problems that once again dominate political thought in the 21st century. I try to be cautious about describing a long-term project like a b…

URL: https://zacharydcarter.substack.com/p/haiti-slavery-and-john-stuart-mill?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: The Federal Reserve Will Move on Thursday. What Will/Should It Do?, &

item.title: Ship of Fools
item.description:
What follows is one of the strangest pieces of journalism I have ever done. It was originally published at Breaker magazine, a crypto-focused outlet which has since folded, taking the archive with it. People keep asking me what happened to it. Here it is. As ever, most of the content on this substack is free- but if my writing is worth something to you, and you have the means to become a paid subscriber, I‘d really appreciate it. Despite my best efforts to self-optimise I still live in a body that needs to be housed and fed…

URL: https://lauriepenny.substack.com/p/ship-of-fools?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: Yet Another Attempt at a Better “Slouching Towards Utopia” Elevator Pitch…, &

item.title: Chartbook #128: Mission command - NATO's Strangelove vision of freedom enacted on the Ukraine battlefield
item.description:
Russian forces attempted to cross the Siverskyi Donets river in eastern Ukraine this month using a pontoon bridge, but their tanks and armoured vehicles were picked off by Ukrainian artillery. So they tried it again. And again. And again. The Russian army made nine attempts to cross the river in the second week of May, according to Ukrainian defence chi…

URL: https://adamtooze.substack.com/p/chartbook-128-mission-command-natos?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

item.description:
Alex Holcombe on Twitter

““Data available upon request” doesn’t work. In case you didn’t already know that, there’s a new study of Biomed Central papers. 1792 manuscripts indicated authors are willing to share their data. 93% either did not respond or declined to share their data.”

Gearoid Reidy リーディー・ガロウド on Twitter
